page.title: 11Samantha's Day, Wray
page.content: I woke at 8 a.m. and went downstairs for breakfast of cereal, toast and coffee. I had my hair brushed and put into a long plait. It only took me a few minutes to walk to school. At school we had assembly, then went to our desks to do some maths. At break, we played Robin Hood. After playtime we worked on our heart projects. For dinner, we had sausage rolls and chips. At 12.55 a taxi came to take three of us to guitar lesson at Hornby Primary School. Back at school later we did English until playtime when I worked on the computer. Afterwards Mrs Blackwell read from 'The Poacher's Son'. After school, I went with Dawn to our den in Spout Wood. After tea, I played tennis at Dawn's. When I went home, I had a bath and then watched television until bedtime at 8.30.
